Reviews.Title: “Exquisite materials and attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: Scrumptious29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight on Sat. March 3, 2012. I must state that my husband and I stayed here for a conference and we stayed for free. Given that we stayed for free, you can take my review as you wish. We stayed on the 9th floor in room 901. This is their standard room. There is nothing to complain about. The bed wonderful, the bathroom is great, especially the deep soaker tub and the high-end Kohler fixtures are great. The shower is very small...I never used it, but my husband said it was small. They have a television located in the centre of the mirror and heated floors. We had lunch in the bar and it was really good. I had the lamb shank with couscous and my husband had a bunch of their appetizers. Everything was excellent and certainly met expectations. The only critique I would have is that the staff is not very personable, but I was only there one night, so who knows.

Reviews.Title: “A business meeting in this very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelbyrns
Reviews.Content: I understand this is a new hotel. We were staying here overnight for a business meeting and dinner. Room extremely nice, clean, large, and wonderful. The bathroom super with heated floor and a TV built into the mirror. We had a room high up. Internet connection , was included but probably only because the conference group paid for it as well as the valet only parking. Probably the only thing once can complain about it is that there was nothing really close to go to eat out. If you are looking for a location for a business meeting or the proximity to the convention centre, etc, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Room--TV in the Bathroom Mirror, Nice Touch!”
Reviews.Author: PatriceToronto
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just celebrated our birthdays with an overnight stay at the Ritz-Carlton Toronto. Everyone in the Ritz 'family' made this a very special event. Even before we arrived staff called me to ask if we had any special requests for our celebration. From the moment we were met at the doors to the time we left we could not have asked for anything! We were met, by name, and shown to a fabulous 10th floor room with a view of the CN Tower and overlooking the Convention Centre-perfect!. Within 10 minutes of our arrival a generous, and outstanding piece of cheesecake was delivered, with chocolate writing that said "happy birthdays!" Following a relaxing afternoon we had dinner in the main diningroom and were given a tour of the kitchen where I will soon be reserving their cooking table for another special occasion I have coming up (dinner was outstanding and dessert-omg!). Sunday morning my daughter and 2 year old joined us for brunch and a fabulous 4-generations swim in the salt water pool. As we were checking out another amazing staffer hurried over with a gift for my granddaughter, and as everyone knows, recognizing someone's grandchildren is so much nicer than being recognized yourself. I'm a Ritz-Carlton convert; you will be too!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Ritz. We were very impressed with virtually everything about it. Staff were incredible. Not a single issue with anyone. And service was over the top. Just amazing. The location was perfect for downtown Toronto - close to everything from restaurants to shopping to the convention centre to ACC or Skydome. Rooms were very nice, decent size, elegantly appointed. They even had a TV hidden in the mirror in the bathroom. That was very cool. And the bathroom, in general, was very nice. The food at the Ritz was also excellent. As were the 2 different lounges - great spots to have a drink and talk to friends. The pool and the hot tub are free - not sure why another review said the opposite. The steamroom and sauna are part of the spa, and so you'd have to pay for those, but the very nice pool area is free. The fitness area is also free and a good size, with alot of modern equipment. The Golden State Warriors of the NBA were staying there the same weekend, so that should say something. If you've got a bunch of multi-million dollar per year pro athletes staying there - and they can afford to go to any hotel in Toronto - you know the Rtiz is good. Overall, one of our best hotel experiences in Toronto. Will DEFINITELY be back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at the Ritz- Carlton, toronto”
Reviews.Author: LeClaire070
Reviews.Content: I loved my experience at the Ritz Carlton in Toronto... The location is awesome, cool restaurants nearby, amazing view, lucky me, I stayed on the 14th floor. However, I got to see the incredible suite on the 19th floor because the Ritz was hosting a function to celebrate the success experienced since its official commencement a year ago. I was served amazing food and excellent wine. There was no way to feel anything but peaceful, elegant and well supported because of the treatment of each and every staff member. And,,,,I got to meet Tim Terceira, a truly gracious gentleman who obviously appreciates his responsibility to his staff and guests. I loved my entire experience.. Thank you Ritz Carlton, Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Robert8181
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Toronto for a weekend. It was a great experience. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable with excellent amenities. The hotel has a great spa, pool and fitness facility. The onsite restaurant was very enjoyable. Will definitely stay at the Ritz whenever I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, staff and service!!”
Reviews.Author: AmericaG89
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Toronto for the first time this past weekend. It was a last minute trip and I did not know what to expect. I stayed at the Ritz Carlton and it was the best decision i could have made! From the time we were outside the door, greeted by front services and then checkin in at the Front Desk with Aarti, who by the way is very professional and absolutley amazing and very accomodating, to simply being greeted by someone in the lobby every single time we walked in or out of the hotel. Jeff at the front desk accomodated my friend and I and assisted us in giving us options on where to go eat and what to do at night! He was extremely helpful. Ali was always at the hotel when we walked in and he was very nice and always greeted us with a smile! The rooms are absolutley amazing! we had an incredible view of the tower and the lake and the beds are very very comfortable! the weather was extrmely cold, but i will definitley go back to visit Toronto and stay at the Ritz any other time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Resq28
Reviews.Content: before a blab on here. Great food, great coustomer service, great room, great spa. +++++++ My girlfriend brought me here for a Staycation/birthday. We went for the bed and breakfast deal I believe and added the spa package. We recived a gift card for christmas for the Ritz so this came in handy at the end or our one night, one day blow out...$1200. Now, this was becuase we had a gift card and drank a ton and ate a ton at the beautiful restaurant Toca. and got the full spa package Things i loved about the Ritz, coustomer service was over the top, Spa was clean and the attendants over the top helpful, i walked around the whole time in my classy thick robe. told them we were there for my birthday, their was a beautiful cake and a card from staff in our room, the room was so nice and comfortable. I can really go on for hours, really a lot of money but I have never had so much fun or felt so comfortable in one place, for 24hrs we never left the property. beautiful...beautiful.. thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Spa at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Happy11_12
Reviews.Content: Living in Toronto we decided to take advantage of a couples massage session at the Ritz Carlton Spa. What a surprising delight. The ambiance, decor, in the facility was extremely soothing. The change room, the rest area while waiting for the massage therapists were just right to prepare ourselves mentally for the massage session. The staff in the spa were the kind of friendly and helpful you wish you would encounter everywhere (a pipe dream right!). The two therapists were great. They applied the kind of pressure that went deep in loosening knots we didn't know we had. It was as if their fingers could see/read .. my partner and I both agreed on the pleasure of the experience. Salvatore and Young.. ask for them.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Adamtsal
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night (unfortunately...). Room was huge, very elegantly furnished. The bathroom is amazing, with a TV inside the mirror, which is very useful if you don't have a lot of time, as you can catch up on the news while shaving! The staff were very helpful. Sure I am going back.

Reviews.Title: “Posh!”
Reviews.Author: the_lowdown
Reviews.Content: I was there recently for business and thoroughly enjoyed it! Location - in the heart of the entertainment district; beside the Rogers Centre, across from Roy Thomson Hall, Princess of Wales theatre, and Metro Convention Centre Room - posh and spacious, especially the bathroom with separate tub, glass shower, and toilet stall. Had never seen a TV screen displaced on a bathroom mirror! The king-sized bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. As a previous reviewer noted, the room was extremely warm, even with the heat shut off. Amenities - large fitness centre that had everything I needed for a cardio and weight workout. A nice touch was the water cooler filled with cucumber and lemons. Salt water pool looked lovely with cedar lounge chairs for a Zen look, all on the same floor as the spa. Food - had a buffet breakfast and lunch served during our business meetings. Excellent! Front desk - courteous and efficient. Plus, I hear many celebrities stay there. When I was there, the Buffalo Sabres were also there.

Reviews.Title: “This is way theres an expression "putting on the Ritz"”
Reviews.Author: CHIP G
Reviews.Content: Excellent value due to the corporate rate recieved from the corporate conference. Rooms and the bathroom especially were Gorgeous!! First Class hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: evianlives
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in a beautiful one bedroom suite on the club floor. When we arrived, we were whisked away to check-in and offered a welcome beverage. The kids were given special toys and were thrilled. The room was like a small apartment, very comfortable and modern. We loved the dark, wood floors. Both the bed and pull-out were comfortable and the view was very cool. At night we were mesmerized by the lights on the CN tower. The first night we had room service and it was delicious but the second time we ordered it was not as good. The staff were very friendly and eager to help with directions or recommendations. The lobby did resemble an office building but that didn't bother us at all. The view was beautiful but the area is not the best during the winter. Not many places within walking distance to pass the time. If you stay in the Yorkville area (as in the Four Seasons, Park Hyatt, Hazelton, etc.) there are shops, restaurants, museums right at your doorstep. The Ritz is close to the harbourfront and would be the perfect place to stay in the warmer months. The pool was not as impressive as other Ritz-Carlton properties. The Club Lounge was extremely spacious and had a very good staff. We would definitely stay at this property again! Give it a try, you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Property!”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorVacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property just after opening in July and I have one word for it, MAGNIFICENT!! From the moment you check in, you are treated like royalty. The staff is exactly what's expected of a luxury hotel, but the room are what really make you want to stay forever. Everything from heated floors to a TV in the bathroom mirror, makes you feel like royalty when you are staying here. I have nothing bad to share about this hotel and would highly recommend it for everything from business to pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, friendly luxury”
Reviews.Author: rjosborne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days over Christmas and had a virtually perfect time. The staff were attentive and friendly, without being obtrusive. We wanted to organise a small afternoon tea party for some friends, and this was organised, outside the normal routine, without a fuss, to a very high standard. The breakfast pancakes were fantastic - fresh, hot, light and tasty. The relative lack of other residents over the holiday was a real plus for us - we almost felt we had the place to ourselves. Beds were very comfortable, and general standards were as one would expect from this class of hotel. Altogether, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: JTofAshland
Reviews.Content: Great staff / room / food / facilities - all meeting expectations of the "Ritz". The only negative I could think of is the room was warm - even with the heat off - probably due to residual heat from the hallways being overly warm. A shame really because I wish I could have needed to use that big fluffy comforter!

Reviews.Title: “well done”
Reviews.Author: kajah4
Reviews.Content: In a world of hype not all of the players can deliver. the Ritz does. The staff are knowledgeable helpful and deliver the goods. The rooms are well appointed clean and comfortable. I did notice some noise from 7th floor.. i was on 6th. The rates are a premium but in line with all other 5 star hotels. Overall a good choice and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: mmcmap
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Toronto with my husband and 2 children for one night. We were in town to see a play and decided to try the new Ritz Carlton. We stayed on Club Level in a double bedded room. The property is nothing special, on par with a Hilton or a Hyatt. The room was small, the bathroom, while surfaced in marble, is a large square space separated into a very small shower and stall by opaque glass that does not reach the floor or ceiling. The entry from the hall is very narrow and if the closet doors are open the walkway into the room is blocked. The Club Level offerings were meagre, peanuts in the afternoon, a few appetizers at dinnertime. The breakfast, however, was plentiful. The property itself is very comfortable but also very stark. The staff is not nearly as friendly or accommodating as the staff at other Ritz properties we have visited. We asked for early check in at 1:00 and our room was still not ready until 4:00 at which point they switched us to a different room without the view we had originally booked. There are many lovely choices in Toronto and once the novelty of this hotel wears off I believe this hotel will not be a top pick for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynD
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and this is now one of my favorites. I'm not always a fan of modern hotels, but the Ritz-Carlton Toronto is first rate. Gorgeous and interesting architecture, very good service (front desk and concierge were helpful and professional), good room service food, very clean and spacious rooms, excellent pool and gym. The restaurant is good, my only complaint is that it isn't open for dinner on Sunday evenings, the only in-hotel option is the bar/lounge. But I find the place very relaxing. The hotel just has a very pleasant and calm vibe, which is perfect for exhausting business travel. Business center is adequate, not great.

Reviews.Title: “so so ..”
Reviews.Author: dun d
Reviews.Content: I satyed at this hotel.Its new yes but tthe hype that its Ritz is overstated.Its not like a Ritz in the cayman Islands or some resort.Lobby is average except the chandelier .Rooms are morden but way overcharged even breathing in there is charged i guess..not worth it.outside they put a sign Ritz carlton like its some strip joint not impressed.service just as any other hotel if not less coz of the price ,i guess i will need more since i pay high.All in all its an average hotel hugely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “4 and 5 star?”
Reviews.Author: tripp
Reviews.Content: new, but definitely lacking in character... The service was definetly not of a 5 star Sure they have a LCD TV incased within the mirror does that make you a 5 star hotel. We only had Breakfast and drinks at the bar (all the cups a breakfast were dirty on our table) the food was ok and very expensive. 21.00 dollars for a white egg omelette with nothing else on the plate(come on) We had 14.00$ Margarita no snacks! Shampoo, conditionner and shower jel in the shower only...don't forget your soap or your shampoo if you want to have a bath! cheap, cheap !!! Love the radiant heat, the marble bathroom, the bedding, the locations I just think they need some fine tunning to really make a five star hotel. We have stayed at the Four Seasons in Toronto, the Intercontinental on Bloor(4 star), the Hyatt on Bloor they have every details covered.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFamilytrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz for one night...celebrated my birthday with my husband. The location was perfect. Upon check in they upgraded me to a beautiful suite. the service was absolutely amazing and the room was perfect!! I couldn't find one thing to complain about. I am usually very picky, but really could find nothing wrong with this hotel. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was terrific. Thank you Alan (front desk) for the beautiful room and for the amazing service. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The new Ritz in TO”
Reviews.Author: lcf2001
Reviews.Content: It's my second time at the Ritz in Toronto. I used to go to the Royal York when I was in TO. I've also stayed at the Park Hyatt from time to time. For what I do and need when I'm in town, it's hard to beat the Ritz-Carlton. It's close to Toronto Island Airport, it's close to the downtown core business district and the rooms are comfortable and well decorated. The front desk service at arrival as been an issue both time I came in, but apart from that it's been a positive experience. But to get a 5 star rating from me, they need to get up to speed when we check-in (for example, wrong room when you arrive with a gift basket for another guest, screwdriver left in the bathroom from maintenance, etc...). I am going back on November 29th, so will see. In the meantime, it's a very good start for a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Even beyond our (high) expectations”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RC Toronto with my wife and our 10 year old son during a 4 night city-trip to Toronto in late October 2011. First of all the hotel does not come cheap but it is definitively worth the money. This was our first trip to Toronto so it took me quiet a time to browse through all the hotels on Tripadvisor but finally I decided to spend some extra money and enjoy a luxurious hotel. I never regretted it! The hotel itself is brand new and conveniently located on Wellington Street right behind the Metro Toronto Convention Center and the CN-Tower. You will be able to walk to almost all sites in Downtown and the Financial District, but you will need a taxi to get to Bloor/Yorkville. From the moment I entered the lobby I felt right at home. I was greeted by everyone I encountered with my full name minutes after arrival. Luckily I was upgraded to the Club-Level whereas our room was on the 16th floor facing the lake (1615). The rooms are brand new with the usual understated RC luxury. Everything was clean and comfy as expected. We got a room with 2 beds, one for the Master and the other one for my wife and myself. At first I thought about an additional extra bed, but the beds are huge. So sleeping space was no problem. Even with the 2 bed in our room there was enough space for the 3 of us. We never felt cramped. There was sufficient closet space for all of us. The hallway of the room is light marble whereas the living room is lined with carpet. There is a complimentary tea- and coffeemaker in the hallway as well as the fully stocked minibar. The marbled bathroom had ample space, 2 sinks, a separate WC and a separate walk-in shower. The mirror had an embedded TV. The view from the 16th floor was nice but not overwhelming. The only minor negative point about the room was the connecting door. After falling asleep around 20:00 at our first night due to the jet-lag I woke up around 23:00 hearing loud voices and party noise in the other room. After lying awake for 15 minutes I decided to call the front desk. Within minutes security showed up and it turned silent for the rest of our stay. I thought I ha a dÃ©jÃ -vu since this happens to me on most of my long haul trips. I even once accused my neighbor of noise disturbance while staying at The Peninsula Bangkok. Finally I figured out that my wife has left her I pod on the docking station and the music was coming out of the loudspeakers behind our bed. Awkward! What really made our stay special was the extraordinary friendliness as well as the attitude and commitment of the entire Club staff during our visit. Especially I like mention Mr. Hannud from the Club staff who was amazingly friendly. The Club itself is on the 21st floor and we really enjoyed the four times daily food presentations. It started with a sumptuous breakfast followed by snacks for lunch and canapÃ©s before dinner, completed by a dessert buffet just before bedtime. Needless to say that everything was delicious and I gained 2 kg weight. But we literally appreciated the real-value of the hotel and the service commitment of the RC staff just after check-out. We had left Toronto and had already arrived at Niagara-Falls when my wife noticed that she had forgotten all her jewelry in the room-safe. Another dÃ©jÃ -vu since this also happened before while staying at the Mandarin Oriental Boston and had led to some unpleasant surprises. But RC handled everything extremely professional. Within 24 hours (!) the jewelry was returned to us in Niagara-Falls (!) due to the amazing effort of Mr. Krzyztof Mazur from the RC Toronto after driving the complete distance. We are deeply grateful for his service commitment and for sure will never forget this episode as well as Mr. Mazurs effort in our whole life. Always check the room-safe before leaving! Overall we were highly satisfied with our entire stay that was made special though the natural kindliness and the service commitment of the staff as well as the comfy rooms and gorgeous atmosphere. Having stayed in many 5-star hotels around the world including many Mandarin OrientalÂ´s, Four SeasonÂ´s as well as Peninsula hotels I have to admit that this hotel truly belongs into the same category. This was one of the best hotel stays in my entire life. We are looking forward to return to the RC Toronto as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, comfortable and modern but lacking in character”
Reviews.Author: A_Mariner
Reviews.Content: I recently had an opportunity to stay at this new Ritz Carlton for some business meetings. Beautiful appointments, some star power (the musician Sting happened to be staying there at the same time) and no major criticisms. However, after having the opportunity to stay in more "storied" properties around the world that have the significant advantage of ideal locations secured many years ago, the new luxury hotels in downtown locations have to compete with more luxurious furnishings and consumer technologies (like the TV behind the mirror in the suite bathrooms) that really don't contribute much to the overall experience (apart from about 3 seconds of of a "gee whiz" reaction). The service was good and well intentioned, but didn't exhibit the flawless perfection I have experienced at other luxury hotels with teams with decades working together in the same property (the Peninsula in Hong Kong is out of this world in providing timeless, flawless service). The location of the hotel is somewhat unexceptional and given its (understandable) lack of history, the hotel does not exceed the sum of its parts -- a modern, well designed, downtown luxury chain hotel managed by a professional hotel corporation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great service”
Reviews.Author: ClarkGFVA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our first anniversary in Toronto (interests were Niagara Falls, Redskins vs Bills game, checking out a new city) and stayed three nights at the Ritz. We were well treated by all the staff (check in, doormen, spa, bartenders, restaurant staff at TOCA and DEQ, room service) and loved our view of the lake and CN Center. The location allowed jogs along the lake, easy access to the CN Tower, Rogers Centre, and several local quality restaurants/bars. However, Julianna, who works in the DEQ as a bartender was our favorite. She made sure our anniversary was celebrated with style. As great as the service was, it is solely because of her I made sure to write this post about this wonderful weekend. Thanks Julianna!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Place”
Reviews.Author: Callabuffalo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there overnight. Best Hotel in TO. Club level great, as was the restaurant and bar downstairs. Ask for a maple bacon snack at the bar, or a tour of the cheese room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Staff makes you feel valued, in great downtown location for sports, theater and the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyGuy
Reviews.Content: I echo other reviewers that this may be the best hotel I have ever stayed at, though I tend to stay at the chain hotels for busienss travelers. Stayed here while at a convention and had a great corporate rate. The furnishings, the toiletries, the bedding, decor were all top notch. Nice luxury features like a heated floor for the bathroom which is on an electronic timer, not a noisy dial type. The bathroom featured a nice walk in shower and a sopaker tub. There was also a twin vanity. My favorite thing was where the television could be watched 'within' the bathroom mirror, like a ghost image, complete with its own remote control. The hotel was near the Air Canada Center (a few blocks), the CN Tower, the Rogers Center and a block from the Convention Center The only negative for me, was the charge for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Surely not trendy, but top quality all over”
Reviews.Author: PourJF
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate if you like great service, old fashion stylish comfort (but very modern equipments like the famous portion of the bathroom mirror turning into a fully functionnal TV screen), nice view on the water and of course, high prices coming with the Ritz brand. For younger people or people looking for something more trendy like some boutique hotels this is probably a bit too stuffy but other than that, I must admit that it is difficult to critisize this brand new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil luxury”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: They got a 5 last time, and they get a 5 this time too. Easily! The staff are beyond wonderful, the room very comfortable, spacious and decorated in a tasteful sense. Location: Right smack in the middle of the business, entertainment and sports district Hotel: A newly developed property. Not too large. And one important detail, itÂ´s a more contemporary and sleek R-C that what we normally experience which was so refreshing! Check-in: Very pleasant, friendly, smooth and quick. All of the Front Desk staff are a joy to deal with Room: We had 1204 which is a corner suite (same room type as last time), overlooking the city. And it just checks every box for me. We unfortunately had to move rooms (smooth process though) and ended up in 2005 which is the same type of room, but overlooking the CN-tower and the water. Must say that itÂ´s a bit more quiet traffic wise. ProÂ´s: Very large Great storage space for both clothes, suitcases and in the bathroom Separate shower/bath Underfloor heating in bathroom Excellent layout Guest bathroom Possible to adjust the temp individually in between the 2 rooms Tastefully decorated Quiet Husband loved the TV in the mirror in the bathroom ConÂ´s: There is definitely space, so why is there not even a hook to hang ones coat on etc in the hallway? Bedlinen could be nicer ie softer Light in bathroom is not great for make-up purposes The amenities are "just" R-C own range The minibar in the fridge is not cold at the top (all 3 that i have encountered at least) so the beverages on top are actually warm Staff: They really are what makes this hotel so top-notch! Every single one of them are so service minded, smiley and helpful in that "just so" personable manner which makes you feel seen as an individual guest and not just another person drifting through leaving your money behind Service: See above Food: * In room dining arrived fast and tastefully decorated. But we had ordered burgers rare and they arrived well done. Not so good. * Toca is a wonderful restaurant!!! Nice to look at and the food is fabulous!!! Also, the childrens menu is on an Iphone so after figuring out what the child in question should eat they can entertain themselves with some games. Nice touch :) * The meals on the club level is a quiet and very pleasant experience. And some nice choices despite a small selection. Internet: Fast and wireless, but not free. Too bad. Spa: Very spacious, calm and classy. My therapist was a pleasure to deal with. BUT, had asked for a regular bikiniwax though, and ended up with a French one before i knew it...Very annoying. Little details that make a world of difference: * Our little daughter spotted all the pumpkins down in the lobby (it was Halloweeen after all) and she just loved them and wanted to buy one. The FD staff over heard that and when we got up to the room there was a bag there with a lovely card and a little pumpkin inside. That really made her, and subsequently our, stay super nice!!! So thank you Brooke :) * Also, Tom Brodi the chef of Toca spotted our daughter in the restaurant one night and asked if she wanted to come see something really cool. Of course we all trotted off towards the kitchen where he procedeed to whip up some fresh cotton candy for her. Score!!! All this just to say that the people that work at the R-C really cares which just takes ones stay to a whole different level!

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: peeauslee
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Toronto over the Canadian Thanksgiving (who knew?) weekend in October. It was everything that I could expect from a luxury hotel. Fabulous, comfortable, and quiet rooms. Spectacular facilities, including the best on-site Fitness Center of any hotel that I have visited. The hotel also features a very nice bar/restaurant by the name of Deq, a quiet oasis from the hustle and bustle of Toronto. All of this, combined with a great location and a very capable staff, makes for a great weekend in the city. The only negative is the $9.99 fee per day for wireless. Guest to hotel management - Is it really worth ripping off your guests and continually being hammered in online reviews by charging for this service???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Awesome Stay. Best hotel I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: vliou
Reviews.Content: Thought i'd share my first stay at the Ritz in Toronto. My Sunday evening began checking into the Fairmont Royal York on a Gold Floor suite as a Plat. member. What I saw was horrendous. My fiancee had this look on her face that she was disgusted. Moldy showers, noisy Air Conditioning (Rattly) and get this, boarded windows. Suffice it to say that even though this stay was prepaid, we promptly got our money back after I had some interesting words with their gold floor manager. We quickly booked a room at the Ritz and everyone, absolutely everyone, went above and beyond their duty. From the highly attentive and friendly doorman to the people who checked me in, even the manager who printed close to 750 pages that I needed in an emergency and stapled everything....what a great 3 days. I even enjoyed the bar to drown my stress on a Monday evening. All in all, thank you to the staff at the Ritz in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Falls short of 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: p8patyger
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel not quite a year old. From the outside, the architecture is nothing special. The lobby and check in area are quite ordinary. The room has the latest amenities: HD TV, Bose IPod player/clock radio. Lots of pillows but all of them soft. I'd have expected extra touches like slippers, an extra blanket. The dimmer switches for the bathroom are way too complicated. Someone waking up in the middle of the night would not want to struggle to get the right brightness, they just want to turn on the light. I wonder how many guests find the TV on the shower door useful, or would admit to it. The food I ate was buffet style type fare served for conference attendees so perhaps it is unfair to compare with a meal at the sit down restaurant. The service was polite but I've seen a higher level of service at other 4 or 5 star hotels. The place just doesn't have the wow factor that a Ritz Carlton led me to have. I did not see the spa and the other facilities which I'm sure are top notch. Overall not an impressive hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Spa was fabulous but dining at DEQ was far below average”
Reviews.Author: Picarina
Reviews.Content: As we live in Toronto, we went to Ritz-Carlton Toronto for a spa getaway. Our experience at spa was excellent and we booked another spa day next month. Staff at Spa was very professional as staff at other Ritz-Carlton hotels. Since the faciliites are only 6 months old, they are very modern and highly recommended. After having such woderful experiences at Spa, we expected dinning would also be superb. TOCA was closed so we went to DEQ for lunch. What a terrible service and low quality of food. My wife's flat bread with chicken was half burnt and took forever to get food and a bill. My sandwich... not very good. Next time, after spa, I will go to Royal York for dining instead (or skip lunch and eat at home) I will never eat again at Ritz-Carlton, especially at DEQ. Creppy food. Even McDonald has a better quality control. I expected more for a $28 sandwich and $22 flat bred with fries and soup.

Reviews.Title: “They Donâ€™t Call it the Ritz for Nothing”
Reviews.Author: Hornlihutte
Reviews.Content: Well, they donâ€™t call it the Ritz for nothing and the new Ritz Carlton Hotel in Toronto did not disappoint. Throughout our two-day stay at the end of September, the most delightful plus was the attitude of the staff, without exception. We were made to feel welcome from our arrival at the front door to our departure. From my point of view, the Hotel is not in the most advantageous spot, but the facility itself is really quite special. The Club Lounge is the best we have seen in any hotel. The ambiance is quietly elegant and the food spectacular and relentless. We were able to enjoy a wonderful lunch within minutes of arriving while the Club Level Concierge looked after the mundane aspects of checking our credit card details. The card was returned to us, complete with room keys, as we nibbled. When we decamped to visit our room, two floors down, the luggage was already in place. The Club-Level Room was more than adequate. The layout was efficient, with the wardrobes and closets, including both a room safe and minibar and the entrance to the bathroom, all being just inside the door, and with the room itself beyond all that necessary clutter. With respect to amenities, all I can say is wow! There was a Blu-ray DVD player (which could handle regular DVDs) attached to a 42 inch TV which was actually connected to a converter that produced a proper 16 X 9 aspect ratio picture. My usual experience in Toronto is a 16 X 9 aspect flat screen TV on which everyone looks short and squat and grainy because they have merely stretched out a 4 X 3 picture onto a 16 X 9 screen. Another pleasant surprise was that the bulbs in the lighting fixtures were sufficient to actually read by. This is not, as a rule, the case in hotels. The room also had a Nespresso Machine (not the usual Dreadful Drip Device), and a BOSE Wave Radio-CD Player, complete with MP3 dock. A touch I have never seen before was a remote control in the Bathroom that allowed you to access TV in the bathroom mirror. Personally, I do not watch TV when away from home in a hotel, but for those who do, this is would likely be a special treat. The bathroom was spacious and had separate areas, with frosted glass doors, for the WC and shower. The first night we ate at the TOCA Restaurant. The TOCA Restaurant is a little awkwardly situated, being right above a sometimes noisy bar called The TOCA Bar, located just inside the entrance to the Hotel. Also, the ambience OF the TOCA Restaurant leaves a bit to be desired, featuring diner-style tables without table cloths. Overall, the impression is a bit cold and sterile. From my point of view, the Cheese Cave was the most intriguing feature of the restaurant. A visit during dinner is recommended. It may influence your decision regarding dessert; it certainly did mine! The meal was more than adequate and they know how to make a straight-up dry gin martini without ice. My wife had the Plat du Jour, which was spaghetti with shaved white truffles. On invitation, the chef himself, Tom Brodi, came to the table and added additional shavings of the â€œwhite goldâ€� until told to stop. I have to add, that he came equipped with an electronic scale on which the additional goody goodness was weighed out, needless to say, at an added cost. I had a taste, and the eventual result was â€œto die forâ€�. The second night, we ate at DEQ, a bar located at the back of the Hotel, down a few steps. We ate there because, it being Sunday, the TOCA Restaurant was closed. The seating suitable for dining is limited, but luckily for us, it not busy when we arrived ,and the service and food were both creditable. The server even went out of his way to find me the local craft beer that I had enjoyed at TOCA the previous night, one that was not actually on tap at DEQ that night. The Hotel is directly connected to the PATH, an underground maze that allows one to get from the Ritz (which is almost at the Southwest end of the PATH) right up to the Eaton Center (which is almost at the Northeastern end of the PATH). In conditions of inclement weather, this is a major plus. With respect to negatives, they were few and far between. There is a public park across Wellington Street and during the weekend that we were in the Hotel, there was almost non-stop, and very loud live music being played there as part of a festival called Nuits Blanche. We could hear this easily in our room even though the windows do not open. How common such intrusions are I am not sure, but I hope it was an unusual departure from blessed silence. The Nespresso Machine was very nice, but supplying just four capsules, two of them decaffeinated, was a little stingy I thought. We used the two â€œrealâ€� capsules on Day 1, and, after the room had been cleaned, on Day 2, they had been replaced with decaffeinated ones. Ouch. To "cut to the chase", we have already booked our next stay at the Toronto Ritz Carlton. It will be our new home away from home in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “What Service”
Reviews.Author: Dil K
Reviews.Content: This is a Hotel like no other in my opinion in Toronto. The staff will go out of here way to treat you with great respect and courtesy and will tailor your needs individually. My favourite place on the property was DEQ. The staff here should be given medals for their hospitality. I felt like I was with close friends and the drinks were stunning. I had an apple martini which blew my mind. In the Bar at the front of the Hotel the genius bar tender "Moses" made me an off menu drink called "dark and stormy in the rhubarb patch". I had a serious relationship with his drinks ... The rooms are beautifully appointed and a haven of calm. The pool is large with great views of the Tower. The spa is delightful and luxurious. The main fine dining restaurant is quite impressive. I had a 45 day dry aged rib eye which was the best steak I have ever had hands down! The sommelier selected a great red wine pairing so I recommend you trust their advice on wines. Overall the service was incredible and exceeded the high standards I expect from the Ritz Carlton. I was in Toronto for only 48 hours on an international trip and felt so relaxed from staying here that I could have been there for 5 days if I had not looked carefully at my calendar. Stay here in Toronto, If not then at least have a drink here.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: abuscaglia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to this new Ritz in Toronto. We usually stay at Four Seasons but decided to try the Ritz. Great location. Beautiful Hotel. Very comfortable bed. Service not quite at level of four seasons but hotel nicer and better location.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of TIFF”
Reviews.Author: TarunChanna
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay during the TIFF. Everything is absolutely brand new. They have a great new gym even though they dont have a leg press machine. Their pool is a little on the small side but their hot tub is hot! The hotel has a happening couple of bars on the ground floor - both with smallish patios but still great parties happening in both during the TIFF. The rooms were more than spacious and the service is over the top amazing. A really great place to stay in Toronto at any time. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Alisa2010
Reviews.Content: Loved the Ritz! Rooms are beautiful, with Bulgari White Tea amenities, coffee maker and a very well-stocked minibar. Internet access and bottled water are complimentary. If you like peace and quiet, you may want to call in advance to make sure you get a quiet room, as some of the rooms are on the side with the deck where parties take place sometimes. Reception is prompt and professional without being cold. In-room breakfast was delicious! When back in Toronto, will be back at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to Return........”
Reviews.Author: PoorPelvis
Reviews.Content: This will be our first choice upon our return to TO. We've stayed at 4 other hotels in the area and have decided this is our favorite and the best (and we LOVE to be pampered and spoiled at our hotels.) My husband and I come to TO every September for the Jays vs Yankees series. This hotel is a very short walk to Rogers Center. Minutes away from some great restaurants, a short cab ride to Eatons center, and my new shopping favorite, Yorkville, Bloor Street! The service at the Ritz is simply fantastic, the staff are so friendly and completely customer orientated, all staff we were in contact with were more than willing to accomodate our needs. The atmosphere and surroundings are perfect. We did not have a chance to enjoy any of the restaurants on site but did order room service, which fell short of my expectations. The room itself was a one bedroom corner suite that was very quiet and clean, (although there was papers and a gift bag with lotion from the spa left behind from the previous guests.) It was large and the bed was comfy. In my opinion there is a number of "touches" that could have been made to make it a 5+ hotel, such as heated towel bars, doorbells (cannot hear knocking when in the bedroom), DND signs that are electronic rather than door hangers, electronic curtains, etc. The spa was very, very nice, comfortable, clean, and well equipped. I had a 90 minute massage booked with Brad and enjoyed every minute of it. He did exactly as I asked of him and was completely professional. I normally have a female therapist but one was not available for the time I preferred, but am so glad it turned out the way it did. Worth every penny! Overall, we loved the hotel and service (maybe just the name and what it represents to be honest) and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Vvrreenniiee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what we expected of a Ritz-Carlton Hotel. The rooms were very big, the beds comfortable and the bathroom was like an oasis - very big, light and it was the first time that I saw a TV integrated into the mirror - an additional luxurious detail. The staff was extremely friendly. The front office staff always greeted when we entered or left the hotel and the porter even recognized our name on arrival - something like this has never happened to us before and made us feel very welcome. Extraordinary job! We had booked an executive room with access to the executive lounge. The staff there was very friendly and help. The catering there was amazing. The food was delicious and neatly arranged. However, I would have appreciated if they had vacuum cleaned the Lounge area again after the breakfast as the floor became quite dirty during the course of the day. As the hotel is situated in the middle of Downtown Toronto sites and shopping areas can be easily reached. Many restaurants are close by. This makes you very flexible. Although staying at this hotel is quite expensive I have to say that it is worth it. We would always come back.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Lkm995
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at TOCA is unsatisfactory 1. Table arrangement is uncomfortable. 2. Table utensils look modern, but are not user friendly. 3. Music is loud and distracting for that hour of the day. 4. Menu is a la carte, ends up with a bill of between $40/person, food quality is fair and non inspiring. Reception is not great during checking out. 1. The receptionist said she would e mail the bill to our address and it would seem reasonable. When asked for a hard copy to look through, I detected Â several errors which were double charges for the Internet and phone items.Â Suggest you check your bill and not to allow her to say we will e mail the bill to your account. Location of this hotel is poor in relation to The Four Seasons with no shops and restaurants unless one walks for a distance. This hotel cannot be recommended for those traveling for leisure

Reviews.Title: “Wow in every corner we turn!”
Reviews.Author: PJONG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch luxurious. We book for a corner unit with a CN Tower view and we were pampered traveling as a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children). If you are looking to pamper yourself and your companions this is one of the hotels in Toronto.Â  Nice hotel features: (this hotel has a long list of great features but I'm just going to name a few that matters to us) > Big corner room with everything modern. Including the coffee machine! > Valet parking for a flat fee with unlimited ins and outs. Two Bose sound units in our corner room. Give us a great listening pleasure.Â  > Built-in TV in the washroom (best washroom we have come across from all the hotels we have stayed ).Â  > Flat rate internet fee for unlimited devices (we have 2 laptops, 2 blackberrys and 3 iPads all getting strong wirelessÂ Internet signal). > Fitness room that's open 24hours > Spa service that will spoil you Not-so-nice features: (something we wish it could have or do better) > Breakfast doesn't come as buffet. (we were hoping for a Sangri-la hotel's style buffet which we have tried while staying in Taipei). All we get is a plain ala cart breakfast and nothing interesting for our kids. > Pull out sofa bed has metal edges which are unsafe for little kids. This could have been fix with some sort of covering to cushion the metal.Â

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with the WOW factor!”
Reviews.Author: TheFairy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to Toronto. We chose this hotel as it was featured as a special offer when we booked our flights with BA to get 3 nights for the price of 2. We expected luxury and the hotel did not disappoint with the advantage of everything being brand new. The rooms are very spacious with a separate bar area, large desk and sitting area. The real wow factor though is the amazing bathroom with a 'hidden' tv screen in the mirror, large bathtub & separate walk in shower. We didn't try the restaurant but there is a great outdoor terrace at the back of the bar where they serve light meals and snacks which were very tasty. All in all an amazing experience and a great opportunity to sample this luxury at an affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff - Personalization of Stay was PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: 99p38a
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel: location, clean, well appointed guest rooms, etc. You can read all the others and get that. Here is what made it an EXPERIENCE for my wife and 2 year old. Put in a 10am Saturday morning requested arrival. I didn't expect to get it, I had planned accordingly. I arrived at 11am, the attentive valet attendants opened both car doors for us, loaded up a bellcart, entertained my 2 year old while I told him what stays and goes from the trunk. He must have saw me put my daughters DVD player in the seat pocket, which you will read about later. Walked into the lobby and proceeded to check in with Aarti. She let me know she saw the request and that they were fully committed last night and didn't have a room ready yet (huge political figure funeral across the street made that pretty obvious, roads blocked, etc). She asked what our plans were for the day, in the mean time, the front desk manager (assume ?) came over with a stuffed Ritz Toronto Moose for my daughter. Aarti and I discussed Buskerfest, festival we came into town for, as well as some other things to do on the way. She said she was sorry and would get a couple housekeepers in a room and rush it, I said no worries, we will be gone for the day. She upgraded me to a city view room, up on 16 I think. What a great view, nice large room. Next day, at checkout, I told her I had left all of my bags in the room and asked to have a bellman run them to my car because we are leaving to sightsee again and will get the car from valet later in the day. She said that she was looking thru the paper and recognized my daughter in a picture. She emailed me the link and said the hotel didn't carry that paper but she was sending a bellman to get one for us. We came for our car that afternoon, all loaded up, DVD player put up and powered on, waters in the car, nice hand written letter from Aarti clipped to the newspaper on my front seat. Awesome service! I have no complaints about the stay. My daughter played in the soaker tub and watched cartoons on the TV built into that bathroom mirror while we took turns showering, it was that relaxing of a stay. I wish I brought her bubbles, we usually don't give her the baths on a 1 night stay. Can't comment on the fitness center or restaurants unfortunately. Room was super clean and well appointed. Shoe horn, tie rack, lint brush, great minibar/martini/snack selection, bose ipod dock, blueray player, nice TV. Aarti, the doorman and valet where on when we can and left and were very spot on about details that we shared. They made us feel that it was at a personal level and they really enjoyed us and our excitement for their city. I have stayed at a number of Ritz Carlton hotels as well as Luxury Boutiques, I understand the level of luxury service and this was above the norm. Thanks to all! I want to start seeing wifi TVs in the new luxury hotels tho. Netflix, Hulu, Pandora, Youtube.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in most ways, but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Blurgeshmurg
Reviews.Content: I quite liked a lot about the hotel, but at about $400 a night I don't think it was worth it. The service was very attentive, but sometimes overly so - a bit self-conscious and fussy. My room was nearly perfect - nice desk and sitting area. But the sliding bathroom door kept bouncing back when I tried to close it, and we could always hear the howling wind through the shower vent. These are little flaws, but for this price I expect perfection. And finally, I thought the decor in the lobby and common areas was garish. To me, the Ritz-Carlton brand should mean timeless elegance and glamour, but they've bought into every current design fad on this one. It will look embarassing in a few years!

Reviews.Title: “The Height of Luxury in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Chappaqua3
Reviews.Content: A deluxe 5 star experience form check in to check out. My husband and I stayed in a corner suite with my 15 yr old son. Room has 1 1/2 bath which is very nice. The highest level of amenities from Nespresso coffee maker, to heated bathroom floors, soaker tub, LARGE HD sets with Bose sound system, Beautiful linens, robes, towels. TV in bathroom mirror. ANything that you can imagine was there and the service was equally outstanding. We were on a weekend package that included breakfast and valet parking. It was a bargain. One other note. Have not been Toronto in 5 years and boy has it changed. Incredible shopping and amazing restaurants. As a Native NYC girl, I can say that it actually gives my city a run for its money. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional from check-in to check-out”
Reviews.Author: sishak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. The welcome was extremely warm and polite, as if you have known the employees from before. Front desk was always helpful when we had questions. The room which was a deluxe king room was amazing! Although we didn't get our requests for the view and the floor, we don't have much to complain about. The bed is ultra-comfortable, with alot of pillows. The TV is huge (42" plasma) with BLU-RAY player, and a bose ipod dock. The bathroom was beautiful, with heated floors and a TV screen in the mirror that was quite useful in the mornings. The shower is spacious with a rainfall shower and a hand-held device shower. Room service was extremely fast (less than 30 minutes) and fresh. We had burgers and jalapeno poppers that were very good. The brownie was ok. The hotel is situated in the Financial district, and is a few minutes walk from Blue Jays st. where you can find many restaurants. The pool on the 5th floor is AMAZING! Not too big but extremely clean, with beautiful pool-deck amenities, towels, water and every kind of bathroom amenity you would think of in the bathroom (even hair gel!). Overall we were extremely satisfied with our experience and strongly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_Law_Guy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at the Ritz-Carlton Toronto. It was a phenomenal experience all-around. We booked a one bedroom corner suite through our Virtuoso travel agent back when the hotel was not yet open. We were able to get a fantastic rate of 385 CAD a night with the third night free. The Virtuoso benefits provided included: an upgrade to a "view" room on a high floor, free breakfast each morning, a welcome amenity (assorted fruit and still/sparkling waters) and a $100 spending credit during the stay. The hotel is brand new and you can smell the newness in the rooms and public areas. Check in was a breeze and we were provided with the correct room with all our requests for high floor, bedding type honored. Everyone was very friendly at the front desk. Check out experience was also uneventful and the bill was accurate in spite of so many moving parts with the free night, Virtuoso benefits, and Gold elite free high speed internet access. The suite was impeccably decorated and have very comfortable. The bed was especially comfortable- the only grievance I have is that the duvet and cover were so heavy that I got a little warm at night even with the temperature at 65 degrees. The rain shower was perfect pressure and temperature wise. The TV in the bathroom mirror is a great touch and something I definitely will look to have at home in the future! Housekeeping service was thorough and toiletries replenished as needed. Turndown service was similarly good with used towels exchanged, drawing of curtains, and bedside waters and chocolates. The Nespresso coffee maker in the living room was a nice touch; you can make your own espresso or regular coffee with one-use capsules. The room is well-stocked on coffee mugs, espresso cups, spoons, all types of glasses (drinking, champagne, wine), and ice bucket (which is filled at turndown). The TV selection was significant and the picture quality was excellent. One pet peeve we have about other hotels is when they spend a lot of money on flat-screen TVs but then don't bother with HD connections, leaving a pretty fuzzy TV picture. Not the case here. Internet access was fast and available either in hard-wired or wireless versions. I didnâ€™t pay for this service as it is complementary for Gold members, but I believe it would have been $9.95 a day, noon to noon. We ate at TOCA by Tom Brodi (breakfast) and DEQ bar (lunch). Both were fantastic. The lunch fare at DEQ bar is limited, but we had some great tasting lunches there. I even ordered a cheeseburger "off-menu" and it was no problem at all. I also had a ham, cheese and caramelized onion sandwich that was quite tasty. We also had late-night drinks there with some friends one night and had a great bartender, Chris. TOCA has a good selection for breakfast. I stuck with the continental, which came with some of the best croissants I have ever had. My partner tried the macadamia pancakes, fruit smoothies, and assorted muffins, scones and croissants. We enjoyed everything and the service was attentive and thorough. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is a few blocks from the CN Tower and Metro Toronto Convention Centre. There is a metro stop a few blocks away on University Avenue, so you can get around the city very easily. Overall, we loved our stay at this hotel and we look forward to returning with family next year.

Reviews.Title: “The best of R-C 2.0”
Reviews.Author: NH_Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a spectacular property. The building's design and execution take the light wood and marble Ritz-Carlton style (2.0) to a new level of accomplishment. Even better, and considering that this property has been open for only a few months, the service (particularly on the Club Level) was seamless, personable, and professional. The standard rooms and bathrooms are quite large for a city hotel, and come equipped with all the amenties one could want (check out the "special" martini olives in the honor bar). And if you wish to eat on premises, you won't be disappointed. Even a business dinner for 50 we attended there one night was a delightful experience all around. Good location (entertainment district, Rogers Centre) combines with good quality and service to really distinguish this hotel. Toronto has a new and vibrant contender.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: worldwidewanderer93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were very impressed. Only 7 months from opening it is virtually flawless, already a step above any other hotel in the city, including the Four Seasons, Park Hyatt, Windsor Arms, all of which we have stayed at before. On the last night we were joined by four friends and dined in Toca, also excellent. If you want the best, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, Beautiful Rooms, and a Miserly Vibe...”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: I found the new Ritz Carlton to be wonderful in many ways but just short of excellent and here's a quick recap: Pros- Service from everyone was polished, punctual, and friendly. Rooms, bedding, and bath are excellent and immaculate. Lobby feels more stylish, intimate, and modern than most Ritz Carltons. Cons- Door closure mechanisms are extremely noisy, especially for a new luxury property. Very miserly with amenities. Overt capitalism diminishes the otherwise excellent hospitality. I did enjoy the Ritz and kudos to the wonderful staff, but there were some shortcomings I found to be out of place. For starters, there were no slippers in the room to wear to the pool, one bar of soap to cart around between the shower, tub, and sink, and a general failure to fully restock toiletries as needed. I'd never found that at other Ritz properties and was surprised. Second, I thought the stated fee of $50 was a bit overboard to use the sauna and steam room, which were fine but certainly not top-of-class. Given the room rates, this fee seemed like a crass money grab. Third, my neighbors awoke me twice well after midnight accepting their room service order and when placing it back in the hallway. Unless people are conscious and considerate, the doors slam loudly and can wreck a night's sleep. At 9:30 am, their leftovers were still outside my door, which is also not something typical for a Ritz. All told, it was good but could have been much better. Maybe they will keep polishing things up a bit before the Shangri La and new Four Seasons open. Location is neither good nor bad in my mind. I do prefer being in Yorkville for leisure, but the hotel is well-suited to those with business in the financial district, as well to King and Queen West. If you like excellent hip casual dining, I really enjoyed Luma, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel on King West.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and a credit to the brand”
Reviews.Author: TouringWillis
Reviews.Content: I know you expect the best at ritz Carlton, but have to say this new, more modern example of the brands hotels is the best yet. Service is exemplary, rooms have great touches like the in mirror televisions. Lounge is well worth the extra cost. Huge gym. Terrace at back of hotel with views of CN tower. You cannot be anything other than impressed with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, details are appreciated.”
Reviews.Author: lindolaura
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service was super. All the extras you could want or think of. Wine glasses (red and white), champagne flutes, martini glasses all in the room. Expresso maker, full bar, safe, mini fridge, Bose docking station, personal reading lights. Location is amazing. Walking distance to restaurants, night life, theatre district and shopping. Looking forward to staying there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, gracious people, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Kimmie53
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over 20 times since it opened in March 2011, a testament primarily to the gorgeous bathrooms and gracious staff. That being said, there are problems that should be addressed by management: - inconsistent room service. Poor selection, overpriced, but worst of all, each time I order the same thing, the quality and quantity vary. For example, sometimes they forget the bread that comes with a salad, and it is often stale. A small dinner salad with five shrimp and cookies for dessert cost $58.00. - no traveler friendly restaurant in the hotel - inconsistent housekeeping. I have at different times found the sewing kit and mouthwash missing. Food in the mini bar is not refreshed. I called for hypoallergenic pillows and the next day housekeeping removed them, so I had to call again. Worst of all, they washed out the soiled coffee cups in the bathroom sink and replaced them (long story behind this, but I could tell). - this is an expensive hotel, and yet they charge almost $10 a day for internet service. It is supposed to be free in the lobby, but I find it hardly ever works. The pros: -spacious bathroom, wonderful tub, TV in the mirror - comfortable bed with plenty of pillows - large screen TV The views out of the windows on the opposite side of Wellington West are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDH1London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. Rooms are large and tastefully decorated. Good size bathrooms with high quality fittings (I liked the TV embedded within the mirror). The hotel is very new and seems to lack much atmosphere - we had a drink at the sushi bar which had a "shopping mall" feel rather than a 5 Star hotel. Did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurants. Tried to order room service breakfast before I left for the airport was told it would be "at least half an hour" (for museli and coffee?!) so abandoned the idea and ate at the airport instead. I understand that there will be a Shangri-La opening in Toronto next year and so there will be more competition at this level for the RC. Price we paid via our corporate rate seemed high.

Reviews.Title: “A True Ritz-Carlton experience”
Reviews.Author: arjunlamba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in Toronto for 3 nights in June and the whole experience was just perfect from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. The rooms are fully souped up with all amenities; also the rooms and the bathroom are very large. The restaurant has great food too, and the breakfast was probably the best we ate in Canada The only slight drawback is the location which is a little bit for business, none the less a great hotel, I will definitely stay here when I visit next.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Outstanding property. Hits all the marks.”
Reviews.Author: flouk
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I spent a night before at the Yorkville Four Seasons. I wasn't too disappointed there as I knew it was terribly out of date but thought I'd get a stay there before they tore it down. What I like about the Ritz was the truly gracious and warm service extended by everyone, and I mean everyone. I was taken a little aback as a well suited staff member tactfully approached me at the lobby, escorted me to the front desk where another staff member checked me in, said I had automatically been upgraded, and that my room was ready. The staff escort who was explaining the F&B outlets in the lobby area, then collected my bags and took me to my room. I was so surpirsed that the escort (a lady) was also the bell(wo)man! It was a very charming experience. What I also liked was as contemporary and attractive the lobby was, nothing in the hotel felt too grand or sprawling. They have a great restaurant on the mezzanine, a bar in the front, and a wonderful lounge in the rear with a deck overlooking the little park. The hotel has a fabulous spa and pool (although you have to pay $50 per day to use the spa if you aren't there for a treatment) but the pool is free to use for all guests. The spa though is amazing with a hydro jetted pool (there are built in sections you lie on with at least 20 jets underneath). The relaxation room is stunning with double height windows letting in an abundance of light. It's odd that they charge guests to use the facilitles though - that would be my only gripe with the hotel. The location is superb, right in the financial district, 2 blocks from the CN Tower, across the street from the Convention Centre, a few blocks from Union Station, and in the other direction the entertainment district with several restaurant choices. The rooms are absolutely sumptuous and with all the latest conveniences and toys (in-mirror bathroom TV was fun). They also have the BEST mini-bar stocked with local products, candies, and munchies that I have ever seen. This is the #1 place to stay in Toronto - although I'm waiting with baited breath for the new Four Seasons completion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephlino
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my husband in may and had a great stay! The place is beautiful and in a great location, we walked to a lot of things! It's literally behind the CN tower! It's also not far from a movie theater and dundas square, as well as st lawrence market! The staff was super friendly and attentive, we were greeted outside and immediately were helped with our bags. The front desk staff was friendly as well and very welcoming. We were taken up to our room by I believe a concierge (maybe they didn't have a bellman that day) we were shown the room and all it's features which were amazing! The bathroom was gorgeous with beautiful white marble a separate shower and tub and a tv inside the mirror which was very high tech! The room was very spacious with a nice sized desk and comfy computer chair. Everything was clean and modern! Oh and their mattresses are the most comfortable i've ever slept on, and I ALWAYS have a horrible night's sleep while on vacation because of the beds and pillows. I slept like a baby both nights there, lol! They give you free water which is awesome cause we tend to get thirsty alot and it sucks to have to pay for water all the time, lol The bar is nicely stocked, they have quite a few options for drinks, of course everything is extremely overpriced. Thankfully the fridge didn't have the sensors so we were able to store a few things in there that would have spoiled otherwise! We decided to take look at the pool and gym area just to see what it looked like. The pool was an ok size, big enough to swim a few laps, which i think suffices for a mainly business oriented hotel! The gym was pretty big with alot of machines and options, i think they did a great job with that! We didn't try any of the restaurants cause their menus were not to our liking! We did however have breakfast room service and the food was pretty good, not the best we've had but it was good none the less!! It was a great stay and we would def stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Finally! A great hotel in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: Toronto has slim pickings when it comes to hotels. The Four Seasons (the very first, original one) is very old and needs a remodel. I'd been staying at the Hazelton, but the service there is newly disappointing. Also, with the Hazelton you're pretty close to the street noise of the very happening area it's located in for clubbing, etc. The Ritz here is fresh, modern, plus and well-appointed with great amenities including thoughtful little things like a toothbrush kit and a shave kit. Because it is a Marriott product, you now can collect Ritz Carlton points. That is a bonus over the Four Seasons, although the finish quality is slightly less plus than the 2.0 Four Seasons light-wood style. The service is really great for a fresh hotel only four months old. You don't get a sense that it's not "broken in" - the staff is capable and attentive, and out-of-the-way until you need them, and they take care of things fast. It was cool seeing KD Lang in the lobby. The spa is large, bright, fresh, airy and wonderfully staffed. The fitness center is large and well-appointed. Room service remembers the details, and the mini-bar is stocked with thoughtful - and only slightly pricy - everythings including USB Flash Memory cards, healthy bars, unhealthy things. I can't think of anything about this property or the staffing that wasn't excellent. Valet service is fast! And they stock your cupholders with chilled water bottles. If you order room service - try the black cod. It was so good I had it two nights in a row. Concierge service? Excellent. Normally I would skip Ritz Carltons in a town where there are Mandarin Oriental or Four Seasons properties, but I think this fresh new property moves this Ritz Carlton from a typical 4.35 star to a bona-fide five star property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tan1373
Reviews.Content: Wanted to thank Kimberley Ouellette, Rooms Controller for making the stay very special. We loved the personal touches in the room when we arrived. The rooms were gorgeous and clean with beautiful decor. The gym was new and had great equipment and the pool and hot tub were fab too. We really liked that we could walk everywhere within minutes, including the Eaton Centre and Union station. Made travelling quite easy for the whole group. The staff were all quite helpful and would go out of their way to make your stay better. Thanks for a great girls weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: jayneoliz
Reviews.Content: WOW! Beautiful hotel, great club lounge and a beautiful, luxurious room. My DH & I celebrated our anniversary at the RC Toronto a couple of weeks ago and were very, very impressed. We chose to stay on the club floor and the wonderful food, liquor, service and ammenities more than justified the cost. Without question this is the nicest (and yes, most expensive) hotel we've stayed at yet in Toronto and we've stayed at all the lux hotels in the city except for the 4-Seasons. Dont get me wrong, there are a few lovely hotels in the city that we'll almost certainly return to (The Park Hyatt being one) but the price would have to be attractive comparitively. As many others have mentioned, the level of service and personalized attention from the staff at the RC is simply amazing. Our room was fresh, beautiful and oh-so comfortable. I was in love with the bathroom and spent hours in that gorgous tub soaking with candles and wine. I even tuned in to the, very cool, in-mirror tv for a little while :-) I treated myself to a pedi at the spa and it was blissful in every way - except the bill but that's to be expected. In short, yes, we'll be back, as often as we can swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever by a landslide!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mx3man123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel on Friday May6th 2011. I had booked a basic deluxe room at a government rate of $205 for the night plus the $42 for valet parking. What an amazing deal this turned out to be. I'll just describe our stay there from the beginning to give everyone a good picture of what this amazing place is like. We arrived and a valet came and took our name and gave us a card to retrieve the vehicle at the end. This valet took our bags and brought us to the check in desk, as we approached the desk there was an employee there that welcomes us by name. It took a couple of minutes to figure out how they would know our name but the valet had an ear piece so he must be able to communicate to the guy by the front desk and told him our name as were approaching, either way it was a great first impression. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous, looks better in person that in pictures. When we checked in we were told were going to be getting a free upgrade to a corner suite (BONUS), we were also given access to the club lounge on the 20th floor (DOUBLE BONUS). We had to wait a couple of minutes for our room but I expect that was because they were putting the strawberries in there, our bags arrived in our room before we did as well which was awesome. A concierge brought us first up to the 20th floor club lounge and showed us around then he brought us to our room and took time to show features of this amazing room. If you go tip well as this is a very swanky place and they really go out of their way to assist you. The room was amazing, you come in and there is a small 2 piece bathroom right by the front door, then you enter the living room, from the living room is a hallway that goes past the main bathroom and into the bedroom. Everything in this room was top drawer, they didn't spare any expense when they made this hotel. The do not disturb sign was made of leather even just to give you an idea of the quality of things in this place. The bathroom is huge, all marble, heated floor and a TV built into the bathroom mirror. There was also a 42 inch TV in the livingroom and another one in the bedroom. This is the first hotel I've been to that actually had HD programming, most hotel's have the flat screen TV's but nothing in HD, this place had HD which was great. Internet was $9.95, no biggie but thought maybe it would be complimentary at such a high scale hotel such as this. We were here to go see Lion King at 7:30pm and we had reservations at Big Daddy's Oyster Bar for 5:30. We thought we'd go check out the club level lounge before dinner. What a great idea this turned out to be. The lounge was empty so we grabbed a great spot by the window overlooking the CN tower and skydome, exact same view we have from our bedroom in our room 6 floors below. Something I forgot to mention about the club lounge, ALL DRINKS ARE COMPLIMENTARY! Yes thats right, free booze, SCORE!! If that wasn't great enough they started bringing out appetizers. These appetizers were great, they had chicken and potato, red snapper over veggies, pulled pork on toast, some crab salad mixture, cheese's, breads, small caesar drinks, you name it and they had it. All free as well. We started munching away on the appetizers and realized we were not hungry now to have dinner before the show so we just stayed and ate some more. The bed in our room was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on, quality bedding and a feather bed overtop of the king size mattress, I slept like a baby. You can check out on the TV like most other hotels and the valet got our vehicle for us very quick as well. I can't say enough about this place, it's was absolutely amazing, no complaints whatsoever, it was perfect in everyway. You couldn't even hear people in the hallway or in other rooms, extremely quiet and peaceful The location of this hotel could not be better, you are literally 2 minutes walking distance from Princess of Wales and Royal Alexandria theatres. There are a crazy amount of nearby restaurants to enjoy as well, there is no hotel that has a better location then this place. You cannot go wrong by staying at this amazing hotel. Chocolate covered strawberries were free as well. I had emailed back in March when I reserved this room to have some chocolate covered strawberries be there as it's my wife's favourite.

Reviews.Title: “The most luxurious hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Macbermy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bed room suite for my girlfriends birthday. She went to the Spa as well. This hotel is absolutely amazing in every way. They treated us like royalty. From the time of booking to the time we left. The rooms are balling!! You get what you pay for without a doubt. We ate in Tom Brody's new restaurant Toca. The food is delicious and servers are very professional and knowledgeable. You must go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Member1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton for one night - we stayed in a double bed room with the view of the CN tower. The beds were very comfortable. The room was spacious and very nice - its great when everything is new but not too modern. The only thing that I didn't like was the toiletries in the bathroom - the Ritz Carlton branded products are not that great. Would've been nice to have something better - the one in New York used to have Frederic Fekkai (so something local to Toronto would've even been nice). Overall a great new hotel with amazing service, a great fine dining restaurant, and wonderful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to both guests and details!”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: The hotel scores a 5 for its overall great feeling for how to discreetely, yet very attentively, take care of its guests. I just can not fault it! Hotel: It`s supposedly the only 5 star hotel in Toronto. And even if it`s not, it for sure is the newest one which also means the most flawless.
