Location: If you`re in town for business, ie downtown, it`s spot on. Great communications around the corner plus easy walking distance to the big arenas for sports/music events. Room: We stayed in a 1 bedroom corner suite (1614) with a glorious view over the CN-tower plus the water. The room is very large and has a great layout. The colour scheme is harmonious and classy. There was even a screen inset IN the bathroom mirror so that tv could be watched while soaking in the tub. Furniture both good looking and comfortable. Bed very comfortable! It`s alsp surprisingly quiet given its location Food: Excellent! And the waiters are personable yet professional Staff: You`re greeted with a smile from each and everyone of them! They also remember your name which is always a nice touch. Nothing is too much trouble for them and they even re-opened their gift shop so that we could purchase a last minute gift. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Ritzy and Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Summerfunboy
Reviews.Content: To celebrate another candle on my cake I decided to spend the night at The Ritz Carlton with my Sweetie. I booked the best room availableâ€¦a One Bedroom Corner Suite with Lakeviewâ€¦and we headed downtown to check in. Arriving outside, there were two valets attending another car. Despite seeing us pull inâ€¦neither one came over to take our luggage/car for valet parking. No one was in the other car and for some reason both men were fiddling with it rather than one coming to help us. Finally one came and took the keys and we headed inside. That was to be a pre-cursor to the whole experienceâ€¦very friendly people that are just as bit slow on the service side. Check In found the two front desk people attending others so a staff member guided us over to the Concierge desk where we were promptly checked in. I asked for a late check out and received one no problem. She wished me a happy birthdayâ€¦nice touchâ€¦and I asked for a champagne bucket filled with ice to be sent up to the room. Our room was on the 14th floorâ€¦there are only 200+ rooms totalâ€¦and it was very nicely decorated and laid out. You enter into a hall with a small bathroom on the right and then a living area with 42â€� LCD TVâ€¦small bar areaâ€¦mini fridge with pop/juiceâ€¦glassesâ€¦liquor bottlesâ€¦and snacks. A desk with phone and a couch and a floor to ceiling window completes the area. Walking along a hall you have a spacious bathroom on the right with Jacuzzi tubâ€¦separate showerâ€¦double sinks and a TV imbedded in the mirror. This was a big plus with my Sweetie but unfortunately ours didnâ€™t work. (More on that later.) Continuing down the hall you find the bedroom with a King bedâ€¦nice linensâ€¦another desk and phone and 42â€� TV and another floor to ceiling window. We had a Lakeview room but next time I wouldnâ€™t pay the extra $50 as the hotel is so far from the actual lake that itâ€™s really not worth it. Plus all the ugly condos basically block all but a smidgeon of the view so why bother? Since the bathroom TV didnâ€™t work we called the Front Desk and no one answered. It took repeated attempts over the course of 10-15 minutes before either the Front Desk or Concierge would pick up. In a hotel with only 200 roomsâ€¦that was lacking a bit. The technician arrived and checked things outâ€¦did a few adjustments and said it just needed to load the channels then it would work. Meantime, we were still waiting for our champagne bucket. Againâ€¦such a small hotel should be a bit quicker with their service. We wanted to leave and do some shopping in Yorkville but had to wait for these delays. The TVâ€¦after loading the channelsâ€¦still didnâ€™t work so we called down and they offered us another room. Soooooâ€¦pack up our bags and move to the 12th floor after asking for the champagne bucket to be rerouted to our new room. Same features just a lower floor and different corner view but at least everything worked. When the bucket came it was a small ice bucket like we already had in the room, not the champagne bucket requested. The waiter apologized and went to get another. By this time we had to leave to get some shopping in so off we went. Upon arriving back the champagne was on iceâ€¦there was a small plate of dried fruit and cheeseâ€¦a box of 3 truffles and a birthday cardâ€¦very nice indeed. Unfortunately when I went to make myself a drink I noticed the glass I had brought with me was gone. Now this is a plain, plastic tumbler that I usually bring because A) itâ€™s plastic and wonâ€™t break if I have a moment of indiscretion and B) itâ€™s larger than the glasses most hotels provide so you can mix a proper drink with ice etc. in it. I called down to tell the Front Desk it was missingâ€¦picked up by the maid no doubt. My point wasnâ€™t to recover the glassâ€¦which had no valueâ€¦but to inform the hotel that the maid shouldnâ€™t be removing other peopleâ€™s property from the roomâ€¦especially when we just checked in. If we had checked out and left the glass behind then fineâ€¦remove itâ€¦but to go into a newly arrived guestâ€™s room and remove a glass that obviously didnâ€™t belong to the hotel was wrong. Anywayâ€¦they were very apologetic and actually found the glass and returned it to us. The Concierge called up and said for the broken TV/moving rooms/missing glass problems they wanted to send up some beer(???) I said I donâ€™t drink beer but a bottle of white wine would be nice. This was sent up with a card apologizing for the mishaps. We ordered Room Service and the sandwich was good and arrived in about 45 minutes. Room Service has various menusâ€¦breakfastâ€¦late night etc. and is 24 hours but with a limited selection available after 11pm. There are dvd players for both TVs and pay movies available too. Overall the room was beautiful and the hotel staff all very friendly and accommodating. Service is a touch offâ€¦a little slow and not quite perfectly polished yetâ€¦but the staff makes up for it with a genuine desire to please and reallyâ€¦you canâ€™t ask for much more than that. Weâ€™ll be back at the Ritz-Carlton some day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional property!”
Reviews.Author: SPR006
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the hotel which had only been open for two weeks. Everything from check in to check out was perfect. The staff was professional without being stuffy and never failed to exceed my expectations. My room was beautifully furnished and spacious. The marble bathroom floor was heated and there is an amazing television built into the mirror. I highly reccommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Hoping my son goes to U of T--so we can come back!”
Reviews.Author: educatedtravels
Reviews.Content: Canadian hospitality at it's best! Thank you for making our trip to visit the U of T so wonderful! Even if my son does not go to the University here-we will come back. Service was impeccable, food in the Club Lounge was very good (especially the endless candy jars), room was clean, modern and comfotable and the pool was fun for the boys. Kimberly at the reception desk made my 9 year old's day when Chocolate covered bacon was found in our room after a long day of touring! Thank you so much again! He will never forget this trip. He also wants to come to the U of T.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, luxurious but not quite perfection”
Reviews.Author: Dopanijoso
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the one month old Ritz-Carlton in Toronto for one night and had high expectations given the newness of the property and that it was a Ritz-Carlton. I came away thinking that the Hazelton may still be the best 5 star choice in the city. The positives : 1. It is absolutely spotless and still has that new hotel smell. 2. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable with really nice marble bathroms. Coolest item is the TV in the bathroom mirror. 3. Mostly the staff were very friendly and tried hard to please. 4. The gym/fitness centre was exceptionally well equipped and had a nice looking if somewhat small indoor pool. The less positive things. 1. Lack of wow factor in the rooms. There's nothing wrong with them but just a little utilitarian for my taste and not overly large at about 450 sq. ft. 2. The public areas are equally lacking in wow factor. 3. I was booked under the AmEx Platinum card Fine Hotels programme, despite the fact that the hotel was pretty empty I did not get the room upgrade that I was entitled to under the programme and when I asked for the upgrade the clerk who was checking me in told me the my city view deluxe was an upgrade when actually it is the lowest level room in the hotel. There was availability in every room and suite category according the website. 4. 3 small quibbles : the door of my room did not close properly. The towel basket in the gym was overflowing with used towels even though there were no guests in the gym at 7am. it can't have been cleaned at least since the previous evening given the low usage of the facility. Also they charge $10 per day for internet, if Motel 6 can throw it in when they charge $30 per night can't the Ritz-Carlton do the same at $450 per night? Overall this new Ritz-Carlton is well appointed, well located, spotless and comfortable and a decent choice for travellers on an expense account. But if you want great rooms in a 5 Star hotel in Toronto I would recommend the Hazelton over the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: kak0
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed 1 night at the Ritz-Carlton. Bravo--they have just raised the bar in the city! Upon entering, the lobby is stunningly gorgeous...lots of fabulous touches such as bronze maple leaves embedded in the marble floor, beautiful furniture, interesting light fixtures by Canadian artsist, beautiful bar & artwork abound. A very classy feel. Check-in was absolutely smooth and the room was immaculate with a great view facing the CN Tower and Lake Ontario. Stunning bathroom with deep bath, separate shower, heated marble floors and tv in mirror. It is worth the upgrade to the Club Level as the lounge is very inviting and is very well serviced. A special shout-out to Hamut, excellent Concierge and John also. Pool area is bright and new and warm and the Spa is divine. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - great 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: kimosabi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. I disagree with the earlier reviewer that says this is like a mid American Holiday Inn (I have been to many of those and it is not like that at all). I thought it had some interesting details (maple leafs in the marble floor), beautiful wood, and interesting lighting. The location was great - easy access to the theatre district, to shopping, and it was right on the PATH system. We had a lovely room with a view of the CN tower and Toronto Island. I really liked the bed but husband's side seemed to be slanted (more well used than he would have expected). The bathroom with the heated floor, big shower, double sinks was fantastic and I really liked the Blue Vision TV in the mirror. The hotel provided complimentary drinks and snack for a welcome gift because my husband had told them it was my birthday and there was a turn down service which was a nice touch. The breakfast in TOCA was good although the coffee was weak. We had dinner at TOCA as well and it was good but not great. And we had a snack and some drinks at the TOCA bar which was very good. The service over all was good not great because they still seemed to be learning. It was nothing of great concern but you could see there were still a few kinks to be worked out. Valet parking and breakfast were included in our package. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It has just displace the Royal York as my husband's favourite hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Probably ugliest hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ZoeyCK
Reviews.Content: Surprisinly ordinary looking -- like something that would have been considered fresh and interesting in the 1970s. Poorly designed, cheaply executed, forgettable finishings -- it's shocking how widely the designers missed the mark with $500 million. I expected Ritz to have the old school glamour of Royal York, the attention to quality detail of a St. Germain, the vibrancy of the Thompson ... instead it looked like a Holiday Inn at a sub-standard middle American city. Unbelievable how removed from this century and hospitality industry the managers, investors and designers of the Rtitz appear. Oh, and the poor staff seem to have zero training as they fumble around nervously and cluess.

Reviews.Title: “How do I top this place in Toronto?...you can't!”
Reviews.Author: CC123_11
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to the Ritz for a "weekend in the city" for our anniversary. Spent the extra money for the Club-Level and it was worth every penny. My wife loved the TV in the bathroom mirror, it was tough to get her out of the tub. Staff is by far the most professional I have dealt with in Toronto. They had only been open for 5 days but you never would have known. DEQ lounge was a great way to wind down at the end of the night. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Finally a First Class Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Content: We have been long awaiting the opening of the first Ritz Carlton in Toronto and finally it's here making this hotel the very finest in first class accomodations in Toronto. I stayed here with my wife and two children for the long weekend and it was simply memorable from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. Service is top-notch as what you would expect from a Ritz Carlton Hotel Chain. The swimming pool was perfect for everyone; kids and adults alike. My wife loved the spa facilities and services. The TOCA restaurant and the DEQ Bar and Lounge were great. Great atmosphere and awesome food choices and quality. We have already booked our next stay for the Easter Weekend.
